iwork.eheap2
Class FieldValue

java.lang.Object
  iwork.eheap2.FieldValue
All Implemented Interfaces:
FieldValueTypes
public class FieldValue
extends java.lang.Object
implements FieldValueTypes

This class represents a value for either the postValue or templateValue sub-field of a Field object. It can contain:

  • Formal: This field matches any field of the same name and type.   For 'Post Value' this means that all * template events are matched (if the template doesn't have this field, it will be ignored, if the template has the field with a value or being formal it will also match).  For 'Template Value' this means that only events containing a field with this name and type will match (but value is ignored).
  • Virtual: This field is not sent from the client.  For 'Post Value' this means that this field will only match for a template event that either doesn't have this field, or also has this field marked virtual.  For 'Template Value' this means that all events are matched (the Event Heap won't even check to see if the event being matched contains this field).
  • Value: Some value that matches the type of the field.  For 'Post Value' this means that only template events which contain this field with a different value won't be matched.  For 'Template Value' this means that only events that contain this field with this value will be matched. If no Class equivalent to the type for this field is available from the JVM, the value of this FieldValue object will be represented by an iwork.eheap.WrappedObject.

Constructor Detail

FieldValue

public FieldValue(int valueType)
Makes this object virtual or formal depending on the integer passed in.

Parameters:
valueType - Should be FieldValue.VIRTUAL or FieldValue.FORMAL. If any other value is used, the value will behave as if it is virtual.

FieldValue

public FieldValue(java.io.Serializable value)
Makes this object have an actual value equal to the serializable object passed in.

Parameters:
value - The actual value for this FieldValue object.
Method Detail

equals

public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
Returns true if the passed in object is an instance of FieldValue and if the two objects are either both formal or virtual, or both have actual values and the Serializable objects containing those values are equal. For now this means that FieldValues containing wrapped objects are never equal unless they are the same wrapped object instance (the default Object equals behavior).

hashCode

public int hashCode()
Returns a hashcode for this FieldValue object. If there is an actual value, the hashcode of the Serialized object is returned. Otherwise, FieldValue.VIRTUAL or FieldValue.FORMAL are returned, depending on which type this FieldValue object is.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this type formatted as the platform independent type string for Event Heap types.
